cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn west-northwest then northwest across the southern Gulf of Mexico and move toward the northern Gulf Coast, aiming generally at southeast Louisiana–Mississippi by mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (near Plaquemines Parish–Mississippi River Delta)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for Pinar del Rio, Cuba only (no U.S. coast yet).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas upper coast eastward to the Florida Panhandle, with highest risk along Louisiana–Mississippi shoreline.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible by Wednesday with a chance of hurricane-force gusts if Zeta strengthens before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential storm surge 3–5 ft above ground level along the lower Mississippi River delta and Plaquemines Parish coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals possible, producing flash-flood concerns and operational disruptions.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; high seas and dangerous currents will halt marine traffic.
